item.title: Trump says he might attend Supreme Court tariff case arguments next month
item.description: Donald Trump apparently would be the first sitting U.S. president to be present for arguments at the Supreme Court if he decided to go.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump from firing federal workers during government shutdown for now
item.description: The Trump administration warned it would use the shutdown to shed federal jobs. President Trump said that the cuts were aimed at "Democrat agencies."

item.title: Senate rejects funding bill with no end in sight of government shutdown
item.description: Republican and Democrat senators continued to back opposing bills ahead of vote on stopgap funding that would reopen the U.S. government.

item.title: Trump admin federal job cuts likely to be 'north of 10,000,' Vought says
item.description: President Donald Trump has vowed to target only “Democrat Agencies” for permanent staffing cuts amid the government shutdown.

item.title: Kristi Noem’s shutdown airport video may violate Hatch Act, Sen. Cantwell warns
item.description: Multiple airports refuse to show Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's video blaming Democrats for the government shutdown because of its politica...
